intro: Obione acutibractea, commonly known as the sharp-bract obione, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, elongated bracts that are often brightly colored, serving as an attraction for pollinators. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals that open sequentially. Obione acutibractea is adapted to grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
